name: A Big Enough Hat
description: The PSS Pakled has blazed a trail across the stars, literally. They seize what they want for their ship and leave a trail of debris in their wake. They've also gained some unexpected allies. But can the Clumpship handle the weight of expectation?
rules:
-- This is a single phase event! The phase will last for 96 hours.
-- In a Voyage Event, you will engage in Voyages with ocassional Voyage Encounters that will test proficiencies of your voyage crew.
-- In this event, Gold and Silver skills for Voyages will be CMD and SEC. 
-- Voyage Encounters take place at the following points in time: 1 minute, 5 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, 1 hour, 1.5 hours, 2 hours, and every 2 hours after that.
-- Passing a Voyage Encounter without losing any contests raises the multiplier for Victory Points gained in contests. Losing a contest resets this multiplier.
-- Three of the following traits are randomly chosen for each Encounter: Inspiring, Explorer, Scoundrel, Casual, Playful, Hero, Marksman, Investigator. Using crew with matching traits increases their Crit Chance in contests.
-- Using any version of Becky Freeman, Carol Freeman, Grubdin, Mariner, or animated crew will provide a bonus to antimatter and a permanent multiplier to passively gained Victory Points.
-- Using the PSS Pakled, the Malon Export Vessel, the Breen Warship, or ships with the Ruthless trait will provide a bonus to antimatter.
-- Earn Event Victory Points passively by running a voyage, and actively by winning contests during Voyage Encounters. The amount you earn increases with every Voyage Encounter passed. 
-- Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Bonus: Ruthless (Ship trait), B. Freeman, C. Freeman, Grubdin, Mariner, or animated crew

featured_crew.name: Progenitor
featured_crew.flavor: Burnham met with the Progenitor, who explains their technology capable of designing and creating life.

action.name: We Chose Only To Seed Life

featured_crew.name: Grubdin
featured_crew.flavor: Grubdin's helmet isn't big enough to call a truce, but it's big enough to frame Freeman and Shaxs for Rumdar’s kidnapping.

action.name: I Do Not Have A Big Enough Helmet To Make Ceasefires

featured_crew.name: Freeman
featured_crew.flavor: Captain of the Cerritos, Freeman has a flair for the dramatic, extensive second contact experience, and no time for Mariner’s shenanigans.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Mariner
rewards.flavor: Beckett Mariner is a command ensign on the USS Cerritos. She breaks dumb rules that shouldn’t be there so she can do a better job!

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Progenitor
rewards.flavor: Burnham met with the Progenitor, who explains their technology capable of designing and creating life.

action.name: We Chose Only To Seed Life

screens.text: "Hello, Captain, and thank you for answering my hails. We have a real problem on our hands. I hope you'll contain your laughter and hear me out. It's the Pakleds. They've been attacking ships from various factions and stealing parts to attach to the PSS Pakled."

"There's no shame in needing help dealing with the Pakleds, Captain Freeman. (I'll never get tired of saying that.) They certainly gave my crew and I a run for the money back in the day. They can be trickier than you may expect."
"Hello Enterprises. Yes, we are smart. Give us your warp cores and crimson force fields and Bolian barbers and we won't blow you up!"
"...and sometimes they can just be Pakleds through and through. Still, I recommend we don't underestimate them. We're better off if we all deal with them together. Wouldn't you agree, Captain?"
